review: one of my favourite strategy games ever made good gameplay some balance issues good story and a beautiful artstyle that makes the game still look good even now this game released back on the ps3 and stayed rather unknown for a long time very happy to see people have found this gem
world war 2 anime edition

i played a demo for this game on the ps3 about 10 years ago and it stuck with me so much i finally played it in 2025 and it holds up the strategy game play is great the story is solid enough and the visuals are at least good enough i think definitely worth it

a great turn based strategy game with a compelling story and fun gameplay   its a fun cross between a third person shooter a strategy game an rpg with upgrades to guns and armor for units and a visual novel with a really great fantasy wartime story   the game is fairly casual i dont think its that hard unless youre going for the high rank at the end of every stage but thats a post game thing
good god its peak
the game has given me the same mood when i watched the pacific d
love the art style story and gameplay very unique

after watching someone play this i decided to get it and im not disappointed in it as a matter of fact i feel like im taken back to my childhood where id play ww2 video games and watch documentaries about the war maybe i wouldve liked this game when it first came out if i had a ps3 at the time

fantastic game one of the best strategy games ive played the mix of realtime control into a turn based strategy was really interesting and fun to master getting a ranks on as many missions as possible was just the right amount of difficult while still having room for more casual players the story while a bit clunky at times never got dull i will definitely be continuing to play this series
story is great the game itself runs fine but on the second last mission i had a bug which required me to limit fps to 30
great experience have not experience any problems with the game

what a nice wholesome game with ups and downs some missions are gimicky but other than that grab this game when its on discount and enjoy your story from a time were gacha games didnt dominated the market
game of the year 2025
this is a pretty fun casual game an oldie but a goody

the bad  the writing is not very good but with some genuinely affecting moments  aiming can occasionally be janky  i wish there was a retry button  the good  very clean unique visual presentation  gameplay is fun with room for experimentation for strategy with team composition and turn order  generally the good outweighs the bad but not by very much
very fun turn based game with a good story attached to it

fyi i played up to mission like 13 on the nintendo switch this game is almost good it has good setting characters story and gameplay wise it has great ambitions  but the game has some flaws specially when it comes to enemy ai which is one of the worst i have ever seen in any game it is very easy to break a boss battle and make it unwinnable or very very short and easy i will try the 4th entry eventually and i hope they fixed the ai because is literally the worst part of the game

this game was like a crossover between xcom turn based game play and 3rd person shooters the story was basically anime ww2 bundled with magic and the power of friendship  the game had excellently crafted episodes and while i still not sold on the whole lets combine xcom with a third person shooter i did find it to be executed about as well as it could have been and i think this game is worth giving it a shot particularly for fans of turnbased games and such
